Reviews.Title: “Poor Communication”
Reviews.Author: B0yzM0m
Reviews.Content: First of all, I will confess, I made a mistake. I took a "deal" which offered no refund (20 off per night.) I tried to cancel Or CHANGE THE DATES more than 6 weeks out. Hotel management would not work with me at all. I am out hundres of dollars and am heartbroken. Meanwhile, they can fill the vacant room and collect twice... There are much better options out there. Avoid booking with this place.

Reviews.Title: “One Notch Above "Flop House"”
Reviews.Author: wtutz
Reviews.Content: The "used" to be a no frills, convenient, and low cost tourist hotel. We've been staying there for the past 10 years and made the mistake of booking for a Christmas visit. To our dismay, we found that the owners have neglected it to the point where the convenience is overshadowed by the decrepit conditons of the rooms: mouldy bathrooms, holes in bed covers, musty/dirty smell in the room, showers that won't turn off, faulty wiring causing the circuit breaker to fail, rotting bathroom woodwork, knobs missing from furniture and bathroom fixtures, and TV remotes that don't work. The only thing that separates this place from a flop house we encountered in Paris was the lack of visible cockroaches on the walls. Avoid this place - there are now plenty of other options near South Kensignton.

Reviews.Title: “Not so beautiful Brompton”
Reviews.Author: Suetheshark
Reviews.Content: I know London prices are high but there was hardly space to swing a cat in my room when I stayed in April and the place has definitely seen better days. Problem stairs and no lift. In general the bed was OK and wifi worked but breakfast basic and not many other facilities. Clean enough, quiet enough for inner city and convenient for tube, museums et al around S Ken. I was there for 5 days which was too long.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, functional but not a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mariocatlin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location in relation to Liverpool Street, the V&A, Southbank, The Strand and Victoria Coach Station - pretty perfectly located for tube travel to all of these. I didn't expect a luxury hotel but was even so disappointed with the scruffiness of the place and low quality furniture, like the worst bedsit and up five flights of narrow stairs with a window looking at a wall. But as many other reviewers have said, the staff were pleasant, as helpful as they could be and the room had a fridge and microwave which turned out to be handy. The shower was actually very good and the tiling etc quite new. Breakfast was 25 mins late but was very adequate. So in all, it was ok for us as we really only wanted a bed for the night but be aware that this is a very basic hotel in what was once a grand house I imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, shame about the rest.”
Reviews.Author: Janecetal
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it was fairly cheap by London standards and the location is so good for a 1 night stay it was ok but you wouldn't want to stay longer. The room was overpowering with air freshener(which is always a worry). We tentatively walked in and flung open the curtains to reveal a view of..well a brick wall so high we didn't know what the weather was doing. When we checked in we were asked to make our breakfast booking there and then which was served between 6 and 8.30, we said 8.30! They asked "would you like tea or coffee and would you like a boiled egg". I waited for the rest of the breakfast list but that was it so we duly ordered our egg.(they know how to live it up in London). After our evening out we stopped at Janet's Bar which is attached to the hotel but not owned by the hotel I don't think, for a night cap. This was an odd bar with a friendly if slightly eccentric owner and the place became very busy around midnight, but had a great atmosphere, so good we stayed until 2am. The next morning there was a knock at the door and a shout of 'breakfast is ready'. We somewhat groggily got up and dressed to go and find the dining room only to find on opening our door a tray on the floor with 2 cups of tea some cold toast and the infamous boiled eggs. We found this very funny and giggled about this and the whole Brompton experience for some time, it still makes me chuckle now..but I dont get out much. The staff were very friendly and semed oblivious to our puzzled expressions they just smiled and thought were were stiffling giggles because we were so happy to be there. On balance probably wouldn't go there again, but dear reader I have stayed at worse!

Reviews.Title: “BE AFRAID, BE VERY AFRAID”
Reviews.Author: Laoise290288
Reviews.Content: Looks surely are deceptive. Where do I start? The room reeked of cheap air freshener. There were knobs missing from the drawers, windows filthy, and holes in the bedcovers. I dread to think what was under the bed. "Breakfast" consisted of a thimbleful of orange juice, slice of toast and an egg, left outside the bedroom door. There are no dining facilities.To top it all, an error was made by staff @ time of booking & they tried to charge us for two rooms. Never ever again. Learn from my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Standard of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghColin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by my Company for me for a two night stay last week and after reading the reviews I did try to get somewhere else last minute but costs were really high. The hotel was really run down, dirty carpets, toilet and room needed redecoration and the morning after the first night I was scratching all over. The next night I slept on top of the bed covers in my clothes. I have paid the price of not accepting the word of my fellow travellers on Trip Advisor, thinking it can't be that bad and the price is really good for the location. Think before booking !! On a positive note I found the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much for the money. Location great but rooms very dissapointing.”
Reviews.Author: neasup
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Executive twin room but we could not contimplate the stair cases up to the fourth floor every time we ventured out of it. Possibly our fault for not checking there was not a lift. So no fault with the internet information on this point. However it did make it look as though it was favourably decorated. The Executive twin turned out to be the most tatty room we have ever stepped foot in. We could not face sitting in the settee, and the beds were even more tatty, dirty and threadbare. Upon our complaining, we were moved to a family room which was far better decor wise with a fridge. If we had been aware of where our room was situated and that there was no lift we would not have booked this hotel in the first place. It seems a shame that it is situated in an ideal location, the pub under neath the hotel was not a problem (we stayed mid week) but it still is a noisey location to stay and could do with a change of mattresses and shampoo of carpets. However, I would like to state that the staff were more than helpful and they were more than helpful to change our room when requested. They were a credit to the hotel which could in all aspects do with a complete clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tragically Unrealized Potential”
Reviews.Author: Freqtflyr
Reviews.Content: This could be such a great place to stay in London, but can't really recommend the Brompton in its current condition. The staff was friendly, and tried to be accomodating, but things were in such bad shape that it must be a battle every day to keep guests satisfied, or at least pacified. Carpets were terrifyingly grimy and presented a depressing picture on entering the front door to face the first of many dirty flights of stairs. I would start by stripping all the carpet out, and replacing with a dark colored runners on painted wooden steps. Most of room furniture was cheap, didn't fit the room properly and was often broken in some way. Again, a minimalist look would be much better. Ditch the blankets and ugly bedspreads for a duvet and cover that can be washed between guests. Carpet was digusting and needs to be replaced with something that doesn't hold all the breakfast crumbs and spills since breakfast is served in the room. Bathrooms looked reasonably new, but had all kinds of operational problems. Glass shower door didn't seal at all, and the duct tape repair job looked even worse, besides not working. The floor ended up with a lot of water on it no matter how hard we tried. The real tragedy is that this is a primo location - right next to V&A, Natural History and Science Museum and South Kensington Tube Station. The price is reflective of the location, but the condition of the hotel makes you feel like you've been ripped-off. Please get this hotel renovated before this place loses all its legitimate clientele!

Reviews.Title: “Location & Price, Can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: cmmeacham
Reviews.Content: I go to London 3-4 times a year and have been staying here for over 15 years. The Picadilly underground line brings you directly there from Heathrow and you can't be better located in London. Shops, restaurants, museums and transportation are a few steps away and the owners are lovely and helpful. The price makes it one of the best values in London, especially for the location. The rooms are small, but clean and each has coffee, tea and a refrigerator. Breakfast is served to your room each morning and included in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Not so great everything else.”
Reviews.Author: Imabooklover
Reviews.Content: If your not fussy at all and want a place with a great location then choose the Brompton, but I think the are other nicer places for the same value with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Unlikely to stay again”
Reviews.Author: mesamm
Reviews.Content: It's all very well paying less than Â£100 per night (Â£95) for a hotel room in London, but there can still be very poor value for money. Like one of your recent reviewers I am in room 407 as I write, complete with noisy empty fridge (think I'll turn it off) very hard bed, window taped up with notice saying 'Do Not Open Window', missing towel rail and missing sink plug. One of the fronts on the drawers is hanging off and there is no information or any kind in the room about hotel facilities. The staircases and reception are a disgrace - shabby and dirty with threadbare carpets and filthy fake silk flowers in vases, although this room seems clean enough if shabby. The receptionist was pretty disinterested but at least the wi-fi is free. I actually think this is worse than the Gainsborough - another go at your peril hotel. Yet it doesn't have to be like this - I was in the Fairway last week for the same price and although basic it looked as if somebody cared about what impression it made. Not sure what breakfast will be like - perhaps the second installment tomorrow! Of I could always eat at a cafe on the way to my meeting - I'll let you know!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Eamonn5
Reviews.Content: Appalling hotel run by indifferent staff and not worth Â£ 110 a night for a double room. the cold water did not work so it was not possible to shower, the sink plug does not work, poorly maintained and threadbare common parts, dirty windows, terrible Tv reception, no lift etc etc.. This hotel relies on its location to attract customers but is truly appalling.

Reviews.Title: “dirty fleapit”
Reviews.Author: ch51Solihull
Reviews.Content: the only thing this hotel has got going for it is the location other than that it is dreadful

Reviews.Title: “friendly but shabby”
Reviews.Author: bookworm1
Reviews.Content: this hotel appeared to have no lift (I was on 5th floor), Reception was also up a flight of stairs. On the plus side the room I had was clean and OK but the stairs and entrance were very shabby. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: Moose045
Reviews.Content: Arrived very jaded, otherwise would have fled straight away- with or without our money refunded. Noisy (above a late bar) and a hike (unassisted) up four floors- well, OK if really cheap, but it was not. Common parts of the place are knackered- varous mis- matching, threadbare carpets throughout. The room was spacious but soft furnishings were filthy and would have been thoroughly unacceptable at any price. Headboards stained with old sweat, sofa ripped with age and discoloured extensively with in-grain dirt. We climbed on to (admittedly clean) and OK, (but very cheap) quality linen being paranoid not to make contact with the manky sides of the ancient bed. Shower did not work properly; well, quite expected at this stage. Despite beakfast being included, we cannot comment as we felt too repulsed to indulge. These comments are serious- the worst place I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “If only I had known”
Reviews.Author: Poppie80
Reviews.Content: Because of the location of this hotel and the price which was not exeptionally cheap I thought booking this hotel would be a save bet, boy was I wrong.... We booked a room for three nights and end up staying in a different room every night. The first night we stayed in room 407, a room where you couldn't open the window, the bathroom smelled like fungus and the bed was as hard as a rock, the fridge was making a lot of noise, there was nowhere to hang my towel and the light above the mirror was broken. After one night and a lot of pain in my back we want back to the reception to ask for another room. They were so kind to give us a different room, room 411, but this room had problems of it's own. The bed was a bit better than before, but there was also a smell of fungus in the bathroom, and now we had to climb another two flight of stairs to get there and the worst of it all was waking up the next morning and not being able to take a shower because there was no cold water. Even after waiting for 1,5 hours still nothing. That's when we went back again to the reception to request for a different room again, which we got, room 507, in a different part of the hotel. I guess that if we'd immediatly had gotten room 507 we probably wouldn't have been so dissatisfied. But fact is that all of the rooms had many (small) malfunctions which I think is quite appalling for the price that they ask you for it! I used to think that I didn't care as much what my hotel looked liked as long as you had a decent bed and a decent shower, well I guess I will have a better look next time before booking a hotel again! Other than the location there was nothing remotely up to standard in this hotel, so I would recommend highly against booking this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best part was checking out.”
Reviews.Author: Baggy50
Reviews.Content: Old tattered decor, run down stair cases, no lift, shower kept turning off, in-room safe didn't work.......the list goes on and on. I would say that based on the overall quality of the property it should have been half the price that it was. I would not, in good conscience, recommend this property to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Dear me - cheap but still poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: CathGirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to its proximity to the Science Museum and because I was travelling on a budget. This - and the fact that teh room had a (noisy) fridge to cool some water were teh only plus points. As previous reviewers have said, the reception is on the first floor and I too was put on the FOURTH floor with no lift and no offer of assistance with my bags. The room was student-like - sparse, utilitarian, boiling hot and small with an unsturdy bed. I didnt have a fan so had to open the window to be able to breathe and of course was woken by binmen and sirens. The shower was absolutely impossible - in a tiny bathroom and the water was totally scalding - teh temperature controller just span round and round. Breakfast was a small pot of coffee, a thimbleful of orange juice, 2 slices of toast, some butter and jam and a hardboiled lukewarm egg which arrived on a tray 20 minutes early. When i checked out I complained about the shower and was told that it did that, that there was sometimes an airlock which affects the temperature and if only I (silly me) had called they would have come and given it a bang and got it working!!! Grrr - terrible service, dont stay there. Pay a bit extra and be able to sleep and wash.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep dont go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottiesOwner
Reviews.Content: We were in London mid week and needed to stay nearer the city for an appoinment. As we were on a budget we were trying to find somewere not too expensive but we found it very hard to get something under Â£150 that was available on the night in question until we came across the brompton Hotel. From the website it looks quite posh, pictures are not everything. We was up on the 4th floor up a windy stairway which was a pain lugging the cases up and would def not suit elderly people as we bumped into anyway so i dont know how the managed! The room was tight and bathroom you were barely able to swing a cat in as they say! There was no AC in the room instead ther was a plug in Fan which when put on sounded like a Turkey screaching so we had to leave the window open to get air hence the reason we didnt sleep a wink all night with bin lorries and police sirens and everything else. The shower was leaking at the head and was covered over with a bit of plaster when was disgusting looking. My husband asked were the dining room was for breakfast the next morning and he was told they would bring it to the room as the had none! Braakfast was tea toast and boiled eggs! Couldnt wait to get out of there so if you want my advise we would have been safer sleeping on the park bench at least we would of been able to breath naturally and had a bit of quite!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BontWales
Reviews.Content: A perfect location for The Royal Brompton Hospital. Perfect for a one nights stay. Hotel room very clean and adequate for our needs and it was nice to have breakfast in the room. Would recommend as value for money and closeness to tube.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Johncharlesworth
Reviews.Content: i stayed in brompton hotel with my partner. the room was nice and clean. we even have fridge in our room. staff were polite and very nice. we love the hotel and its location . perfect for london. cheap and nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A miserable experience”
Reviews.Author: AnnNSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: The ONLY thing this place has going for it is the close proximity to South Kensington Tube. I don't know where the rooms on their website were - we certainly didn't get one! We arrived late at night from Paris and were given a room that backed onto concrete walls with escape ladders against them . The temperature in the room must have been almost 50C so we had to sleep with the freestanding floor fan on full blast in order to get some relief BUT the noise of the fan kept us awake. Cluttered room space, cheap laminate furniture and nylon bedspread complete the picture. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever encountered; the door wouldn't stay open and when we were showering one elbow banged against one wall and the other elbow bashed against the shower door. It was so cramped. Plus, the shower temperature was stuck on very hot so we could not stand under it without being scalded. This was at 11 p.m. with our suitcases already opened and another 'plane to catch the next morning. What a disaster. We almost cried when we walked into this place, and if it hadn't been so late at night we would have left immediately. I think this place would suit younger people, a step up from backpacking perhaps, or those with very low expectations?

Reviews.Title: “wont stay anymore”
Reviews.Author: bdo_2009
Reviews.Content: i was terrified when i arrived the hotel as there's no lift! i need to drag my huge luggage up 4 levels to my room. nobody will help u in the luggage. basically, no service here. if u r staying w/ elderly, u MUST avoid it since it is definitely not suitable. the location is great and easily accessible to the tube and harrods.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brompton for one week, we had to pay up front because we were given a special rate, this was not worth it! The room was dirty, the walls looked like they had never been cleaned there were coffee and other stains all over the table cloths and the bed spread smelt weird. On day 3 the internet went down and the staff refused to help, even though we told them before our stay that it was crucial we had the internet to do business. On day 4 we had our clothes washed, one of our sweaters came back badly ripped when we complained they blamed us for damaging the sweater and refused to help. The staff were rude and unhelpful when it came to handling any sort of situations that may have arisen. When we complained about this we were told we couldn't expect much for the rate we were given!! Not even electricity and a functioning shower tap!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Hotel what else you expect Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hotandrew26
Reviews.Content: I have recently been to this hotel.Superb Location just 2 mins walk from South Kensignton Tube station. I was looking around to stay on my last day in london and came across this hotel. its very clean as compared to other hotels i stayed in london before. Rooms are clean and good customer service along with breakfast served to room which i liked most. Breakfast is continental but its inclusive that good thing. most hotels around south kensignton are very expensive as compared to brompton hotel. so i can say its good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: Travel_girl982
Reviews.Content: Now, truth be told - this is a really average hotel, with dusty rooms, and a REALLY cramped bathroom. BUT compared to other London Hotels in this price range? It's pretty good. Great location - would I go again? mmmm, nah - increase your budget and stay somewhere nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but minimal service”
Reviews.Author: fenwaygirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an extra night in London at the end of a business trip, on the advice of an Eyewitness guide. The location is great- around the corner from the South Kensington tube. But the hotel was not much better than a hostel. The bathroom was tiny and the door would not stay open. The toilet barely worked; the shower was in need of repair. There is nowhere to have breakfast- they bring it to your room. And the staff is very rude- asking for directions prompted rolled eyes and snarky comments.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for money - very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: DaveyEssex_England
Reviews.Content: Got stranded in London and decided to stay here at short notice. Judging by the pictures shown on their website it looked great. In reality it was awful, depressing, small and the matress was so cheap it was like sleeping on the floor. The shower didn't work properly and the shower controls fell off in my hand. We also switched rooms once because of the high noise volumes. We had to ask for extra towels because both rooms allocated to us had only one towel available for guests per room. The continental breakfast was a joke, consisting of a boiled egg & two slices of toast each with tea or coffee. AVOID the bar located on the ground floor of this hotel (Janet's Bar) We paid over Â£10 for one small bottle of beer and a small glass of undrinkable cheap wine. Places like this really make me sick, they prey on tourists who maybe unfamiliar with the area and over charge ridiculously. Trust me, I work in the South Kensington area and I'm positive you can find a lot better without even trying.

Reviews.Title: “Had to switch hotels”
Reviews.Author: ellroe
Reviews.Content: Wow, this was a disappointment. The only thing going for the Brompton is its fabulous South Ken location, minutes from the tube. Everything else was horrible. We had an "executive" room--it was up on the 5th floor (no lift) and the a/c didn't work, so it was uncomfortably hot the whole time. The headboards were ripped and stained, the beds themselves narrow, saggy, and uncomfortable, with pillows the thickness of pancakes. The couch was also ripped and stained, and the carpet was too creepy to walk on barefoot. On one of our two mornings there, there was no water in the bathroom. For over 2 hours. And although we were paying for internet, it was a very weak signal and kept coming in and out. We finally couldn't handle it anymore and had to switch hotels; we gave them 24 hours notice but they refused to refund us, saying they needed "72 hours notice." 72 hours? Are you kidding me? If this hotel were $40/night, I could understand. But at six times that, I was expecting comfort and cleanliness. This hotel has neither.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: sisterray
Reviews.Content: Our holiday was snatched from the jaws of disaster when we discovered, completely by accident, the Brompton Hotel. We had gone to great pains to book a hotel in advance that seemed perfect, but it was far from it (separate review). We found the Brompton around the corner and it was a pleasant surprise. We switched hotels immediately. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The airy room had a nice bathroom, a refrigerator, free Wifi internet access, tea & coffee. Fantastic location. Not the fanciest hotel, but very comfortable and an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rupture
Reviews.Content: Quaint hotel in a fantastic location, prices were very reasonable for a London hotel. Didn't have any water one night out of three, but room was very spacious and clean. No lift/elevator, so if you're staying on the top floors you will need to drag your bags up. Great location only seconds from the tube and not much noise from the city streets. I would recommend this place to travelers who want to see London and not stay in the room all day.

Reviews.Title: “Appearances are definitely deceptive!!!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller018
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOTHING like their web site, they should be targeted by the Trading Standards Office!!! IT IS VERY, VERY SHABBY !!!! On the site, it gives the impression of being a good standard of accommodation, when in actuality the room we were in fell well below our expected standards. Our room, a supposed 'Deluxe Triple' was dreadful! It reminded you of poor 'student' accommodation. The furniture was old shabby and very dated, the carpet was dirty, the fridge in the room was full size and old, it was noisy and very close to the bed. Wallpaper was hanging off, paintwork was filthy. Most worrying and very unsafe, were plug sockets hanging off the walls. There did not appear to be an obvious alternate fire escape route, except the main entrance and no fire regulation information was displayed in the room. Probably the most annoying thing of all at this hotel was the noise in the early hours of the morning. It sounded like 'freshers week', people chasing each other and shouting. Do not be fooled by the lure of its location, although it omits to mention that it is sandwiched between shops, bars and right on the junction of major traffic lights. Yes it's very near the tube station, but so to are many other high standard hotels which on inspection actually deliver what their web sites say!!!! Thankfully one nights stay in The Brompton was most definitely enough. On a positive note, our sight-seeing trip was fantastic and we thoroughly enjoyed that part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Familiar Environment”
Reviews.Author: SONSO
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel with a very good relation between quality and price. It's like a tipical English house with a familiar environment, it's really well located, and the best is that breakfast is served at room!!!! If I have the possibility of going back to London, I will go back to Brompton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room”
Reviews.Author: Thorbies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Brompton, and were very surprised that the room was so small, mad eworse by the overstuffing of unecessary furniture. Breakfast was provided, but was stone cold by the time we got it each morning. But on the plus side, just down the road from the South Kensington tube station.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel in London ”
Reviews.Author: dollerbills
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels ive ever stayed in!!! Room was nothing like the pic!said double bed and they gave me two singles and said push it together and theres your double quite literally! dark room like a cellar! horrible bathroom!just imagine a bunker and it was worse than that!!!NEVER STAY

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: vwoo
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but I think that was enough!! The memebr of staff when booking in was very rude. He couldn't even be bothered to tell us where our room was, and considering it was down a few corridors and up loads of stairs we ended up getting lost...it also didn't help that the rooms on that level didn't have any numbers on them, so we ended up trying to open many doors!! We didn't come across any bed bugs but the tiles on the floor of the bathroom were broken (dangerous), and the shower wasn't working. The water coming out was scolding hot so to turn it off I had to cover my arm with a towel. I have stayed in some pretty bad hotels in my time but this I just found sad. It could be a wonderful hotel; perfect location and a quite a nice building. Be prepared to pay for your room in advance!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, no problems”
Reviews.Author: jayturn24
Reviews.Content: My parter and I had read many previous reviews of this hotel and were some what hesitant, however having now stayed at the hotel and firmly say our stay was excellent and we and other guests staying at the time whoem we spoke to also seemed very satisfied. The hotels location is faboulous and so central to everying, and the size and decor of the room we stayed in was far better than other larger hotels we have stayed in in the past. Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay! Disgusting! Filthy! Bugs! ”
Reviews.Author: Larychmose
Reviews.Content: I only booked because this was described as a Three Star Hotel. It is not! - NO lift (and some of the rooms are four storeys up). - NO public reception rooms. - 'Sod-you' attitude from the ever-changing staff behind 'Reception' (a tiny cubicle on a landing). - A 'breakfast' that would not look out of place in a Jail - a plastic tray shoved outside your door - cheap bread for 'toast', little plastic-packed pat of butter, same for jam, Lidl orange juice, a boiled egg. That's it! No choice at all. And most of all...DIRTY rooms, DISGUSTING bathrooms, and BUGS! I stopped four nights, and had to change rooms three times. First room was so indescribably filthy I refused to sleep in the bed at all - ripped the cotton sheet out, placed it on top, and slept under my own shawl. The decor: stained, grubby, gritty carpet full of spill marks and fag burns; floral wallpaper from the eighties with stains and marks all over it; bedhead and wall lamps thick with dust. The net curtain at the window was black, it was so dirty. There were accretions of brown grime in all the corners of the bathroom, and only lukewam water would come out of the faucets. The room adjoined the disgusting 'Janet's Bar' (a gloomy little shack under separate ownership, but next door) - and they held 'singalongs' until 1 - 2 a.m. Every word was audible thorugh the paper-thin walls. I got NO sleep at all. I could not check out because my friend was also staying in a separate room, and she had flown into the country to see me. So I insisted on moving room. Second room was also grubby, shabby, dusty; but not noisy. Found BUGS crawling on the bed. I have captured one and am sending it to Environmental Health. I suspect it to be a cockroach. Do not go to this hotel! It is a doss house.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Shanila
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Brompton hotel for 3 nights. I booked the hotel through laterooms.com even though I had seen some positive and negative reviews of the hotel on this site. Our stay was great. The location of the hotel is excellent, just next to the South Kensington tube station. Everything in the hotel was clean and looked new. I think they have done some renovations lately. The double room we had was not too small and the bathroom was very clean and of a comfortable size. I can recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “I had serious problems with a faulty window which crushed my finger”
Reviews.Author: MHU
Reviews.Content: I found the staff seriously unhelpful - after I crushed my finger through an improperly secured hotel room window, which necessitated a trip to the Chelsea and Westminter hospital, hotel staff denied that the accident took place at the hotel, even though one of them took me from my room to a taxi; they refused to reimburse taxi fares to and from emergency dept of the hospital. Needless to say, I will never stay ther again.

Reviews.Title: “Suited My Needs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked at the Brompton earlier this year before I had seen any of the poor reviews posted on this site. Well as far as I am concerned I received a warm welcome. The room was clean and quite spacious. asked for a mini safe and I got it with no problems. Tea making facilities and a fridge included.....well enough for my needs. The staff were curtious at all times. Can't say that I was worried by any noise from the traffic outside. The breakfast certainly leaves much to be desired. I would have been quite happy to pay an extra couple of pounds and have a decent breakfast,a snotty boiled egg really does nothing for me, no big deal, an excellent cheap cafe just around the corner. But having said that, the location is perfect. Close to the tube station. A Post Office and Internet Cafe accross the road and an abundance of good restaurants in close proximity. And for my purposes, the Royal Albert Hall just a 10 minute stroll up the road. Pity there is no lift. I will consider staying there again. The price is right!

Reviews.Title: “views”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay i had at brompton hotel. it was the birthday of my wife..i've stayed for 3 nights...i'll definitely come back...i'd arrive early in the morning ...nearly 7am to our surprise the room was ready...the room was a bit small but very romantique..breakfast in the room, a little table with 2 chairs...wonderful..besides room giving on the street the sunshine in the room..what a nice stay i had...besides it's in the most rich district in london...harrods 7 mins walking..all the fashion shops very near..buses and underground 1 min walking..we have a trip in the city everyday till late at night by bus andto our surprise, the transport system was excellent. i'll definitely recommend this hotel to any one

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this hotel was OK: the rooms are clean even if small. But is ideal for reach easily any zone of London. The breakfast is coffee, toast and eggs, but served in the room: I like eat in my room in the morning. The day when we leave very early in the morning, the staff served us the breakfast at 5,40! Thank you!

HotelInfo.Name: Brompton Hotel London
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Old Brompton Road | South Kensington, London SW7 3DL, England
